titles.title: HP555 O that mine eyes might closed be

properties.verseOrder: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
O that mine eyes might closed be
To what concerns me not to see;

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
That deafness might possess mine ear
To what concerns me not to bear;

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
That truth my tongue might
From ever speaking foolishly;

verse.name: v4
verse.lines:
That no vain thought might ever rest
Or be conceived in my breast!

verse.name: v5
verse.lines:
Wash, Lord, and purify my heart,
And make it clean in every part;

verse.name: v6
verse.lines:
And, when 'tis clean, Lord, keep it too;
For that is more than I can do.
